text: Taylor Run is a small tributary of Slippery Rock Creek in western Pennsylvania. The stream rises in southern Mercer County near Drake and flows south into Lawrence County entering Slippery Rock Creek upstream of Harlansburg, Pennsylvania. The watershed is roughly 60% agricultural, 30% forested and the rest is other uses. ==References== Category:Rivers of Pennsylvania Category:Tributaries of the Beaver River Category:Rivers of Lawrence County, Pennsylvania Category:Rivers of Mercer County, Pennsylvania
title: Taylor Run (Slippery Rock Creek tributary)
